intro: Velleruca longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled velleruca, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and unique floral structure. The plant features finely textured, hairy leaves that contribute to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with elongated stamens that are a notable feature of the species. Due to its limited habitat and low population numbers, Velleruca longistyla is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
